<h4 id="channelencodersettingscaptiondescriptiondestinationsettingsburnindestinationsettings">Channel<wbr>Encoder<wbr>Settings<wbr>Caption<wbr>Description<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings<wbr>Burn<wbr>In<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="outlinecolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#outlinecolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Outline<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="teletextgridcontrol_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#teletextgridcontrol_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Teletext<wbr>Grid<wbr>Control</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="alignment_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#alignment_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Alignment</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting “smart” justification will left-justify live subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="backgroundcolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#backgroundcolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Background<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="backgroundopacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#backgroundopacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Background<wbr>Opacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="font_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#font_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#channelencodersettingscaptiondescriptiondestinationsettingsburnindestinationsettingsfont">Channel<wbr>Encoder<wbr>Settings<wbr>Caption<wbr>Description<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings<wbr>Burn<wbr>In<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings<wbr>Font</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be ‘ttf’ or ‘tte’. Although the user can select output fonts for many different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match. See Font for more details.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontcolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontcolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontopacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontopacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Opacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontresolution_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontresolution_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Resolution</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontsize_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontsize_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Size</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>When set to ‘auto’ fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="outlinesize_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#outlinesize_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Outline<wbr>Size</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowcolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowcolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowopacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowopacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>Opacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter out is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowxoffset_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowxoffset_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>XOffset</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowyoffset_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowyoffset_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>YOffset</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="xposition_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#xposition_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">XPosition</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment parameter. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="yposition_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#yposition_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">YPosition</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

<h4 id="channelencodersettingscaptiondescriptiondestinationsettingsdvbsubdestinationsettings">Channel<wbr>Encoder<wbr>Settings<wbr>Caption<wbr>Description<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings<wbr>Dvb<wbr>Sub<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="alignment_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#alignment_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Alignment</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>If no explicit xPosition or yPosition is provided, setting alignment to centered will place the captions at the bottom center of the output. Similarly, setting a left alignment will align captions to the bottom left of the output. If x and y positions are given in conjunction with the alignment parameter, the font will be justified (either left or centered) relative to those coordinates. Selecting “smart” justification will left-justify live subtitles and center-justify pre-recorded subtitles. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL or 608/embedded. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="backgroundcolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#backgroundcolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Background<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the color of the rectangle behind the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="backgroundopacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#backgroundopacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Background<wbr>Opacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the opacity of the background rectangle. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="font_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#font_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#channelencodersettingscaptiondescriptiondestinationsettingsdvbsubdestinationsettingsfont">Channel<wbr>Encoder<wbr>Settings<wbr>Caption<wbr>Description<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings<wbr>Dvb<wbr>Sub<wbr>Destination<wbr>Settings<wbr>Font</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>External font file used for caption burn-in. File extension must be ‘ttf’ or ‘tte’. Although the user can select output fonts for many different types of input captions, embedded, STL and teletext sources use a strict grid system. Using external fonts with these caption sources could cause unexpected display of proportional fonts. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match. See Font for more details.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontcolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontcolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the color of the burned-in captions. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontopacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontopacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Opacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the opacity of the burned-in captions. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontresolution_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontresolution_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Resolution</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Font resolution in DPI (dots per inch); default is 96 dpi. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="fontsize_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#fontsize_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Font<wbr>Size</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>When set to auto fontSize will scale depending on the size of the output. Giving a positive integer will specify the exact font size in points. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="outlinecolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#outlinecolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Outline<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies font outline color. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="outlinesize_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#outlinesize_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Outline<wbr>Size</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies font outline size in pixels. This option is not valid for source captions that are either 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowcolor_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowcolor_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>Color</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the color of the shadow cast by the captions. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowopacity_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowopacity_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>Opacity</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the opacity of the shadow. 255 is opaque; 0 is transparent. Leaving this parameter blank is equivalent to setting it to 0 (transparent). All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowxoffset_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowxoffset_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>XOffset</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the horizontal offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels to the left. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="shadowyoffset_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#shadowyoffset_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Shadow<wbr>YOffset</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the vertical offset of the shadow relative to the captions in pixels. A value of -2 would result in a shadow offset 2 pixels above the text. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="teletextgridcontrol_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#teletextgridcontrol_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Teletext<wbr>Grid<wbr>Control</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Controls whether a fixed grid size will be used to generate the output subtitles bitmap. Only applicable for Teletext inputs and DVB-Sub/Burn-in outputs.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="xposition_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#xposition_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">XPosition</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the horizontal position of the caption relative to the left side of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the left of the output. If no explicit xPosition is provided, the horizontal caption position will be determined by the alignment parameter. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="yposition_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#yposition_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">YPosition</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Specifies the vertical position of the caption relative to the top of the output in pixels. A value of 10 would result in the captions starting 10 pixels from the top of the output. If no explicit yPosition is provided, the caption will be positioned towards the bottom of the output. This option is not valid for source captions that are STL, 608/embedded or teletext. These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

These source settings are already pre-defined by the caption stream. All burn-in and DVB-Sub font settings must match.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

<h4 id="channelencodersettingsglobalconfiguration">Channel<wbr>Encoder<wbr>Settings<wbr>Global<wbr>Configuration</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="initialaudiogain_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#initialaudiogain_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Initial<wbr>Audio<wbr>Gain</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">int</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Value to set the initial audio gain for the Live Event.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="inputendaction_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#inputendaction_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Input<wbr>End<wbr>Action</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicates the action to take when the current input completes (e.g. end-of-file). When switchAndLoopInputs is configured the encoder will restart at the beginning of the first input. When “none” is configured the encoder will transcode either black, a solid color, or a user specified slate images per the “Input Loss Behavior” configuration until the next input switch occurs (which is controlled through the Channel Schedule API).</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="inputlossbehavior_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#inputlossbehavior_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Input<wbr>Loss<wbr>Behavior</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type"><a href="#channelencodersettingsglobalconfigurationinputlossbehavior">Channel<wbr>Encoder<wbr>Settings<wbr>Global<wbr>Configuration<wbr>Input<wbr>Loss<wbr>Behavior</a></span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Settings for system actions when input is lost. See Input Loss Behavior for more details.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="outputlockingmode_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#outputlockingmode_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Output<wbr>Locking<wbr>Mode</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicates how MediaLive pipelines are synchronized. PIPELINE_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to the other. EPOCH_LOCKING - MediaLive will attempt to synchronize the output of each pipeline to the Unix epoch.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="outputtimingsource_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#outputtimingsource_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Output<wbr>Timing<wbr>Source</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Indicates whether the rate of frames emitted by the Live encoder should be paced by its system clock (which optionally may be locked to another source via NTP) or should be locked to the clock of the source that is providing the input stream.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="supportlowframerateinputs_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#supportlowframerateinputs_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Support<wbr>Low<wbr>Framerate<wbr>Inputs</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">string</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Adjusts video input buffer for streams with very low video framerates. This is commonly set to enabled for music channels with less than one video frame per second.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

    </dt>

</dd></dl>

</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">double</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>A value used in calculating the threshold below which MediaLive considers a pixel to be 'black'. For the input to be considered black, every pixel in a frame must be below this threshold. The threshold is calculated as a percentage (expressed as a decimal) of white. Therefore .1 means 10% white (or 90% black). Note how the formula works for any color depth. For example, if you set this field to 0.1 in 10-bit color depth: (10230.1=102.3), which means a pixel value of 102 or less is 'black'. If you set this field to .1 in an 8-bit color depth: (2550.1=25.5), which means a pixel value of 25 or less is 'black'. The range is 0.0 to 1.0, with any number of decimal places.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-optional"
            title="Optional">
        <span id="videoblackthresholdmsec_csharp">

    <dd><p>When set to “strict”, the transport stream demux strictly identifies audio streams by their language descriptor. </dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>

<h4 id="channelinputattachmentinputsettingscaptionselectorselectorsettingsteletextsourcesettingsoutputrectangle">Channel<wbr>Input<wbr>Attachment<wbr>Input<wbr>Settings<wbr>Caption<wbr>Selector<wbr>Selector<wbr>Settings<wbr>Teletext<wbr>Source<wbr>Settings<wbr>Output<wbr>Rectangle</h4>

<div>
<pulumi-choosable type="language" values="csharp">
<dl class="resources-properties"><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="height_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#height_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Height</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">double</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>See the description in left_offset. For height, specify the entire height of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame height. For example, &quot;80&quot; means the rectangle height is 80% of the underlying frame height. The top_offset and rectangle_height must add up to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - Y in the TTML standard.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="leftoffset_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#leftoffset_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Left<wbr>Offset</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">double</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>Applies only if you plan to convert these source captions to EBU-TT-D or TTML in an output. (Make sure to leave the default if you don’t have either of these formats in the output.) You can define a display rectangle for the captions that is smaller than the underlying video frame. You define the rectangle by specifying the position of the left edge, top edge, bottom edge, and right edge of the rectangle, all within the underlying video frame. The units for the measurements are percentages. If you specify a value for one of these fields, you must specify a value for all of them. For leftOffset, specify the position of the left edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame width, and relative to the left edge of the frame. For example, &quot;10&quot; means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame width. The rectangle left edge starts at that position from the left edge of the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - X in the TTML standard.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="topoffset_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#topoffset_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Top<wbr>Offset</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">double</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>See the description in left_offset. For top_offset, specify the position of the top edge of the rectangle, as a percentage of the underlying frame height, and relative to the top edge of the frame. For example, &quot;10&quot; means the measurement is 10% of the underlying frame height. The rectangle top edge starts at that position from the top edge of the frame. This field corresponds to tts:origin - Y in the TTML standard.</p>
</dd><dt class="property-required"
            title="Required">
        <span id="width_csharp">
<a data-swiftype-name="resource-property" data-swiftype-type="text" href="#width_csharp" style="color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit;">Width</a>
</span>
        <span class="property-indicator"></span>
        <span class="property-type">double</span>
    </dt>
    <dd><p>See the description in left_offset. For width, specify the entire width of the rectangle as a percentage of the underlying frame width. For example, &quot;80&quot; means the rectangle width is 80% of the underlying frame width. The left_offset and rectangle_width must add up to 100% or less. This field corresponds to tts:extent - X in the TTML standard.</p>
</dd></dl>
</pulumi-choosable>
</div>

## Import



Using `pulumi import`, import MediaLive Channel using the `channel_id`. For example:

```sh
 $ pulumi import aws:medialive/channel:Channel example 1234567
```
